## What is Rayshader?

---
## Introduction

Rayshader is a package used for 3D and 2D visualization. Itâ€™s functions can be used to create 3D and 2D maps and ggplots!  It does so through a series of overlays that when applied on top of each other form a 2D/3D map or plot. Rayrender (a subfeature of rayshader) can also be used to rotate the maps and show your creations from all angles as well as render your creation.

## Examples:

.pull-left[
```{r quakes_2d, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}

data("quakes")

quakes_sample <- quakes[seq(1,1000,by = 100),]

quakes_plot<-ggplot(data = quakes_sample, aes(x = lat, y = long)) + 
  geom_point(aes(size = mag, colour = mag)) +
  guides(size = F) + 
  labs(x = "Latitude", y = "Longitude") + 
  scale_colour_viridis_b(option = "B") + 
  scale_size_continuous(range = c(1,10))
```
]
.pull-right[
```{r}
quakes_plot
```
